intro: Hebenstretia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy hebenstretia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the cooler months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Hebenstretia pubescens is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
